summary: Website for VS Appliances Spares and Service (VS Home Appliances Spares and Service) offering AC, washing machine, refrigerator, and electrical services, with customer-facing contact details and a “Book Service” flow; brand selection/brand lists are removed from the customer journey; includes an admin portal to manage technicians; prepare the site for Google indexing via Search Console verification and sitemap submission.
architectural_notes: Remove brand-selection step from the customer flow; service request/booking should not depend on per-appliance brand lists.
Logo assets must match the provided VS logo exactly; logo sizing should be adjustable/responsive where displayed (e.g., header/footer).
Support Google Search Console verification by allowing insertion of a verification <meta> tag into the global <head>.
Provide static SEO files (sitemap.xml, robots.txt) from the frontend/static assets (not backend).
Provide/export the VS logo as static transparent PNG assets in multiple required sizes (e.g., header display and favicon) for review before final integration.
known_issues: Current site logo/assets do not exactly match the provided VS logo; update/crop/clean to make the logo exact as provided.
Deployed site is still using an incorrect VS logo/image; replace it with the user-provided image asset.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Transparent-background horizontal logo matching IMG_20260212_214859~4.png exactly (vs-logo-uploaded-exact-v4-horizontal.dim_800x300.png)
- Transparent-background horizontal logo matching IMG_20260212_214859~4.png exactly (vs-logo-uploaded-exact-v4-horizontal.dim_400x150.png)
- Transparent-background square logo matching IMG_20260212_214859~4.png exactly (vs-logo-uploaded-exact-v4-square.dim_512x512.png)
- Transparent-background favicon matching IMG_20260212_214859~4.png exactly (vs-favicon-uploaded-exact-v4.dim_64x64.png)
- Transparent-background favicon matching IMG_20260212_214859~4.png exactly (vs-favicon-uploaded-exact-v4.dim_32x32.png)

existing_features.title: Create a public marketing website for “VS Appliances Spares and Service / VS Home Appliances Spares and Service” that clearly presents the business name and the offered services: AC, Washing Machine, Refrigerator, and Electrical Service, including messaging that services are offered at an affordable cost.

Add a customer service-request (complaint) registration flow driven by appliance icons: show a grid of appliance icons; clicking an appliance navigates to a page that lists brands for that appliance; selecting a brand opens a complaint registration form and submits a new service request.

Add an admin area secured with Internet Identity that allows an admin to add and manage technicians and to review incoming service requests (including assigning a technician and updating request status).

Display business contact details prominently in the website header/footer and on a dedicated Contact section/page: Phone 9701078342, Tirupathi District AP, Email vsappliancessparesandservice@gmail.com.
Apply a coherent visual theme across the site (layout, typography, spacing, component styling) suitable for a local appliance service business (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette).
Add generated static image assets (icons/branding) to the frontend and use them in the UI (do not serve images from the backend).
Re-run the application build and deployment process that previously failed, and if it fails again, capture the full error output and fix the underlying issue so the deployment completes successfully.

Fix the appliance icon -> brand selection step so that clicking an appliance icon shows only the brand names for that selected appliance (instead of showing all brands across all appliances). All user-facing labels and messages must be in English.

Ensure the per-appliance brand list is represented as a clear, maintainable mapping keyed by appliance (e.g., an appliance identifier), and the brand-selection UI derives its displayed list strictly from the selected appliance key.

Add the uploaded VS logo to the website branding by creating static logo assets from the uploaded image(s) (1770913914518.png / 1770913914518-1.png) and using the new logo in the site header (and anywhere else the logo is currently displayed).

Remove brand selection/brand display from the customer journey: clicking a service card must no longer open a "brands" dialog or show any brand list UI; remove or disable any customer-facing text referencing brands (e.g., "Click to view brands").

Implement a customer-facing "Book Service" flow: provide a clear "Book Service" call-to-action from the services area (and/or hero/header) that opens a simple booking form and submits a service request.
Ensure customer-visible contact details are prominently shown and easy to access on all screen sizes, including mobile (phone, email, and location already used on the site).

Generate updated static logo image assets that match the uploaded logo exactly (1770913914518-2.png), preserving the same visual proportions, colors, and stroke weights, and export them as transparent-background PNGs.
Update the website to use the newly generated exact-logo assets for both the header logo and the favicon, replacing the currently referenced generated logo files.
Update the customer-facing “Book a Service” dialog to remove the fields Email Address, Postal Code, and Appliance Age, including their labels, inputs, and any related helper/placeholder text.

Update Book Service form validation and submission so that Email, Postal Code, and Appliance Age are no longer validated and are not required to submit a request; ensure the backend createServiceRequest call still succeeds by sending safe empty-string values for any still-required backend fields (email, postalCode, applianceAge) until/unless the backend schema is changed separately.

Generate new static logo image assets that match the uploaded logo image (IMG_20260212_214859~2.png) exactly (same proportions, colors, and stroke weights), and export them as transparent-background PNGs in multiple sizes suitable for header display and favicon use.

Update the website to use the newly generated logo assets for both the header logo (in frontend/src/App.tsx) and the favicon (in frontend/index.html), replacing the currently referenced generated logo files.
Adjust the rendered header logo sizing responsively so the new logo looks clean and properly sized across mobile and desktop (keeping aspect ratio intact).

Add Google Search Console site verification support by inserting a Google verification <meta> tag into the HTML <head> in frontend/index.html, using a Vite environment variable so the verification token can be set without code changes.
Generate and serve a static sitemap.xml from the frontend so Google can discover and crawl the site pages.
Add a robots.txt file as a static frontend asset that allows crawling and references the sitemap location.
Add basic SEO metadata in frontend/index.html for better indexing and richer search results, using English text only.
Expose a typed frontend environment variable for the Google verification token by updating frontend/src/vite-env.d.ts to include VITE_GOOGLE_SITE_VERIFICATION.

Update the static sitemap (frontend/public/sitemap.xml) so its <loc> entries do not use the placeholder domain (currently https://your-domain.ic0.app/) and instead resolve to the real deployed site base URL via a configurable build-time setting.

Fix Google Search Console verification injection in frontend/index.html so the HTML head contains a valid <meta name="google-site-verification" content="..."> tag sourced from the existing Vite environment variable VITE_GOOGLE_SITE_VERIFICATION, and does not render an invalid placeholder string when the token is unset.

Generate new static VS logo PNG assets from the uploaded image (IMG_20260212_214859~3.png) that match the logo exactly (same proportions, colors, and stroke weights), export with transparent backgrounds, and save them as static frontend assets under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Generate new static transparent PNG logo assets that match the newly uploaded image (IMG_20260212_214859~4.png) exactly (same proportions, colors, and stroke weights) and save them under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Update the site header logo in frontend/src/App.tsx to use the newly generated logo asset(s) instead of the currently referenced /assets/generated/vs-logo-uploaded-exact-horizontal.dim_800x300.png, preserving responsive sizing and aspect ratio.
Update the favicon reference in frontend/index.html to use the newly generated favicon asset(s) instead of the currently referenced /assets/generated/vs-favicon-uploaded-exact.dim_64x64.png.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a business website for VS Appliances Spares and Service with services overview (AC, washing machine, refrigerator, electrical) and affordable cost messaging
Add business contact details (phone, email, location) to the website
Implement backend data models and APIs (Motoko, single-actor) to support: appliances, brand lists per appliance, service requests, and technicians, including request status tracking.
Add and display the business logo in the site branding (header/footer, favicon as applicable) using a static frontend asset
Add a customer-facing “Book Service” flow/CTA to let users submit a service booking/request
Update Book Service form to remove fields: Email, postal code, and appliance age
Update the site to use the provided VS logo exactly (match/crop/clean as needed) and adjust the displayed logo size appropriately (e.g., header/footer responsiveness).
Add Google Search Console site verification (HTML meta tag in site header) to enable Google ownership verification and indexing
Generate and serve sitemap.xml (and submit via Google Search Console) to help Google index the site
Add basic SEO/indexing optimizations (e.g., robots.txt, metadata) to improve Google crawl/index speed
Generate sample VS logo assets in required sizes (e.g., header and favicon) for user review
